intro: Myoporum mauritianum, commonly known as the Mauritius myoporum, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is considered endangered in the wild.
